intro: Raillardella scaposa var. pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's raillardella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its inflorescence consists of small yellow flowers arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Raillardella scaposa var. pringlei is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun conditions.
